business.headline: ATM cash withdrawals to get costlier from May 1. Here's whyThe Reserve Bank of India has approved a hike in ATM interchange fees, raising cash withdrawal costs for customers from May 1, 2025.

Government drops import duty on key parts for EV batteries, phonesFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the government will exempt import duty on 35 items used to make EV batteries and 28 items used in mobile phone manufacturing.

Sensex, Nifty erase gains to close flat amid tariff uncertainty; Zomato down 6%The S&P BSE Sensex closed just 32.81 points above at 78,017.19 after having gained nearly 700 points in the day. Nifty also followed a similar pattern as it ended with just a 10.30 point gain at 23,668.65.

Air India staff to fly economy as airline tackles passenger concerns: ReportThe move is part of Air India's effort to improve its service and customer experience, following criticism over frequent flight delays.

India open to tariff cuts on US imports worth $23 billion: ReportThe government is trying to reduce the impact of US President Donald Trump's global reciprocal tariffs, which are set to take effect from April 2.
What is Google tax that India is likely to scrap from April 1?The tax is expected to be scrapped from April 1, 2025, as part of amendments to the Finance Bill.

Sensex down over 700 points from day's high. Why stock market turned volatile?Stock market today: At around 11:45 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 51.05 points to 77,933.33 and the NSE Nifty50 declined 17.85 points to trade at 23,640.50.

India likely to remove 6% Google tax from April 1, tech giants to benefitThe Equalisation Levy know as 'Google Tax' was introduced in 2016 to tax payments made by Indian businesses to foreign companies for digital advertising services.

UltraTech Cement shares surge 4% in early trade today. Here's whyGlobal brokerage firm UBS has shared a fresh view on India's cement sector and upgraded stocks such as UltraTech Cement and Ambuja Cement.
Sensex jumps 700 points in early trade. 5 key things to know todayThe S&P BSE was up 739.51 points to 78,723.89 at 10.01 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 196 points to 23,854.35.

TCS, HCLTech, Infosys, Wipro: Why IT stocks are rising todayShares of IT major Infosys jumped over 2%, while Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) shares were trading over 1.5% higher on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). HCLTech shares were also up over 2% and Wipro shares rose over 1.3%.

Sensex, Nifty open in green as FIIs return on Dalal Street; IT stocks gainStock market opening on March 25: The S&P BSE Sensex gained over 350 points higher to open over 78,000, while the NSE Nifty50 gained nearly 100 points to trade above 23,750.

entertainment.headline: Solo Leveling 2: Sung Jinwoo-Ant King Beru clash makes episode 12 a visual treatThe 12th episode of Solo Leveling aired on Saturday, thrilling fans with an intense battle scene as Sung Jinwoo clashed with Ant King Beru on Jeju Island. Was it the best Solo Leveling episode so far? Read on to know.

Reema Kagti on rising star salaries: Pressure on budgets is ridiculousReema Kagti spoke out about the unsustainable pressure rising star salaries are placing on film budgets, while also highlighting the issue of pay disparity between male and female actors.

Adolescence, brilliance of British crime shows, and why US is losing the genre warWith 'Adolescence' winning all over, it is the right time to discuss why British crime dramas are built to last as compared to the ones made in the US in the same genre.

Test trailer: Nayanthara, R Madhavan's dreams get intertwined in upcoming thrillerNetflix has unveiled the trailer for 'Test', a Tamil film directed by S Sashikanth. The film follows a cricketer, scientist, and teacher as they face personal and professional challenges, premiering on Netflix April 4.

Pooja Hegde on PR and online hate: People are spending lakhs to troll meActor Pooja Hegde opened up about being targeted by online trolls, revealing that paid campaigns were run against her. She called the extent of trolling 'bizarre', and shared how it affected her family.

Exclusive: The Yellow Diary's Himonshu Parikh on solo EP Circles, band membersHimonshu Parikh of The Yellow Diary steps into solo territory with his debut EP Circles, capturing the essence of love's cyclical journey. Supported by his bandmates, the EP blends personal experiences with a collaborative spirit, resonating deeply with listeners.

Sonu Nigam faces stone pelting during Delhi University performanceSinger Sonu Nigam's performance at the Delhi Technological University was recently disrupted after he was attacked with stones and bottles.
Comedienne Nikki Glaser weighs in on Ozempic usageComedienne Nikki Glaser has voiced her support for Ozempic as a weight-loss aid, challenging the stigma surrounding its use.

Aarya Babbar reacts to Prateik dropping his surname: You can't change your identityPrateik Babbar's half-brother Aarya Babbar spoke about the actor dropping his father's legacy and adopting his mother's name. Aarya stated that one cannot erase their identity.

Empuraan pre-sales hit Rs 58 crore, Mohanlal's film set for historic openingMalayalam superstar Mohanlal's L2: Empuraan has already grossed Rs 58 crore worldwide in its advance sales. As the film will release on March 27, the film could turn out to be the biggest offering from Malayalam cinema.

Karan Kundrra: I am only a Laughter Chef, can't compete with MasterChef TejasswiKaran Kundrra returns to Laughter Chef 2, discussing the show's impact on normalising men cooking and his reluctance to compete with girlfriend Tejasswi Prakash, who is a participant in the current season of MasterChef, in the kitchen.

Jr NTR reflects on RRR journey as the film marks three yearsAs RRR marks three years, Jr NTR opened up about his transformative journey to portray Komaram Bheem. The actor also shared insights on his collaboration with director SS Rajamouli and the challenges he faced.

Jackson Wang teases second song GBAD from Magic Man 2 ahead of India visitJackson Wang teases fans with his upcoming single GBAD, part of the much-anticipated album Magic Man 2. Known for his experimental style, Wang is also set to collaborate with an Indian artist, strengthening his connection with India.

Sonu Sood's wife injured in car accident, actor shares updateActor Sonu Sood's wife, Sonali, sustained injuries during a road accident on the Mumbai-Nagpur highway.  The actor updated about his wife's condition and said that she is 'doing fine now.'

Adolescence is being slammed for race-swapping. Here's the factRarely has an OTT series created the kind of reaction worldwide as Adolescence, a limited series by Netflix. British PM Keir Starmer has said it should be screened in schools. However, amid the praise from all around, Adolescence has been accused of race-swapping. What is the fact, and does it really matter in this case?

Actor Elisabeth Olsen reveals if she is going to return to MCU for Avengers filmsHollywood star Elisabeth Olsen discloses if she is going to make a return to the Marvel Cinematic Universe for the upcoming Marvel films, Avengers: Doomsday and Avengers: Secret Wars.

'Called me names like h****khor': Kangana Ranaut vs Hansal Mehta over demolitionKangana Ranaut criticised Hansal Mehta for his alleged selective silence over the demolition of her office in Mumbai, calling him "bitter and stupid". She also asked the director, with whom she collaborated with in Simran, to stay out of her matters.

I'm shattered: Pawan Kalyan remembers karate coach Shihan HussainiActor and Deputy Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh, Pawan Kalyan, paid an emotional tribute to actor and karate coach Shihan Hussaini. He died at a private hospital in Chennai on March 25 after battling blood cancer.

Actor Jugal Hansraj condemns personal attacks on Ibrahim, KhushiActor Jugal Hansraj criticises the harsh trolling of newcomers Khushi Kapoor and Ibrahim Ali Khan following their film 'Nadaaniyan', highlighting the negative impact of social media's instant criticism culture.

general news.headline: Ranya Rao's 'confession' in gold smuggling case: Money sent through hawalaAnti-smuggling agency DRI told a court that Kannada actor Ranya Rao, arrested in a gold-smuggling case, had confessed to transferring funds via hawala for purchasing gold.

Is a political storm brewing in Bangladesh? Explained in 5 pointsProtesting students who ousted PM Sheikh Hasina from power have formed a political party, radical extremists are marching on the streets, the Yunus government seems to have lost the plot, and there are reports of heightened military activity. Is a political storm brewing in Bangladesh? These five points will provide clarity.

Kunal Kamra takes on Shiv Sena with new song after Mumbai studio vandalismKunal Kamra, who is under attack by Shiv Sena for mocking Eknath Shinde, upped the ante against the ruling coalition with a new video.

BJP's 'Saugat-e-Modi' Eid kits to benefit 32 lakh MuslimsThe BJP today launched the 'Saugat-e-Modi' initiative, which is expected to benefit 32 lakh underprivileged Muslims, who would receive special kits to celebrate Eid.
How creators are turning to OnlyFans, without the adult contentCreators are earning millions of dollars on adult content platforms without making adult content.

Did Rana Sanga invite Babur to invade India, sow seeds of Mughal rule?Samajwadi Party MP Ramji Lal Suman called Rajput ruler Rana Sanga a "traitor" in Parliament, claiming he invited Babur to "invade India". The remark sparked a massive controversy and reignited a long-standing debate. Did Rana Sanga invite Babur to India? Here's what historians and historical records say.

Sit down, party is your husband's: Nitish Kumar jabs Rabri Devi in Bihar councilNitish Kumar took a jibe at Rabri Devi, calling her inconsequential except for being the wife of RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav.

Video: Boxer Saweety Boora assaults husband Deepak Hooda inside police stationIn a video that has gone viral, boxer Saweety Boora has been seen assaulting Kabaddi player Deepak Niwas Hooda inside a police station in Hisar, Haryana. The incident took place on March 15.

Will BJP gamble with a first woman national president?The other options are a South face to counter the DMK-led delimitation narrative or a staunch organisational leader who has served time in the Modi government

Dead infant, body parts stuffed in plastic jars dumped near nursing home in PuneThe body of a newborn and the body parts of five to six infants were found in a garbage dump in Maharashtra's Pune district. Police said preliminary probes suggested that the body parts could be part of a biomedical waste released by a nursing home.

Disha Salian death: Aaditya Thackeray, ex-top cop, others named in complaintThe lawyer of Disha Salian's father has filed a case with the Mumbai Police, accusing Aaditya Thackeray, a former top cop, and others in his complaint.

Has Trump triggered US brain drain, the biggest since World War II?The US might witness an exodus of researchers, if media reports and chatter on social media are anything to go by. The flight of scientists might be the biggest since scientists fled Nazi Germany. With President Donald Trump slashing research funding and increasing work visa scrutiny, European countries are planning to seize on the brain drain from the US.

Umpire Nitin Menon retained in ICC Elite Panel, Michael Gough and Joel Wilson outNitin Menon enters his sixth year as an ICC Elite Panel umpire. Joel Wilson and Michael Gough, two of the finest umpires, made way for two new entrants in the panel, updated on Tuesday.

How Ashutosh Sharma braved injury for Vizag heist: DC coach Hemang Badani revealsIPL 2025: Delhi Capitals head coach Hemang Badani revealed Ashutosh Sharma was in danger of missing their first match against Lucknow Super Giants, revealing he suffered a cut on his finger two days before the game. Ashutosh hit 66 off 31, helping Delhi Capitals recover from 65 for 5 to successfully chase 210.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
